1.text: My soul is weary of my life: I will give free course to my complaint; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.

2.text: I will say unto +God, Do not condemn me; shew me wherefore thou strivest with me.

3.text: Doth it please thee to oppress, that thou shouldest despise the work of thy hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?

4.text: Hast thou eyes of flesh? or seest thou as man seeth?

5.text: Are thy days as the days of a mortal? are thy years as a man’s days,

6.text: That thou searchest after mine iniquity, and inquirest into my sin;

7.text: Since thou knowest that I am not wicked, and that there is none that delivereth out of thy hand?

8.text: Thy hands have bound me together and made me as one, round about; yet dost thou swallow me up!

9.text: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as clay, and wilt bring me into dust again.

10.text: Hast thou not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?

11.text: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and knit me together with bones and sinews;

12.text: Thou hast granted me life and favour, and thy care hath preserved my spirit;

13.text: And these things didst thou hide in thy heart; I know that this was with thee.

14.text: If I sinned, thou wouldest mark me, and thou wouldest not acquit me of mine iniquity.

15.text: If I were wicked, woe unto me! and righteous, I will not lift up my head, being [so] full of shame, and beholding mine affliction;—

16.text: And it increaseth: thou huntest me as a fierce lion; and ever again thou shewest thy marvellous power upon me.

17.text: Thou renewest thy witnesses before me and increasest thy displeasure against me; successions [of evil] and a time of toil are with me.

18.text: And wherefore didst thou bring me forth out of the womb? I had expired, and no eye had seen me.

19.text: I should be as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.

20.text: Are not my days few? cease then and let me alone, that I may revive a little,

21.text: Before I go, and never to return,—to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;

22.text: A land of gloom, as darkness itself; of the shadow of death, without any order, where the light is as thick darkness.
